oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Soil biological quality in short- and long-term field trials with conventional and organic fertility input types
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Fließbach, Andreas
Schmidt, Christoph
Bruns, Christian
Palmer, Mike
Nietlispach, Bruno
Leifert, Carlo
Tamm, Lucius
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Soil biology
Soil quality
Composting and manuring
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Soils of the DOK trial and three other field trials with manure input were analysed for effects on soil biology. While long-term effects indicate a new steady state at the DOK trial site, differences at the other field trials suggest that fresh manure at the Bonn trial and chicken manure at the UK sites are at least temporarily advantageous, probably due to their relatively fast mineralization.
oai_dc:dc.dc:identifier: Fließbach, Andreas; Schmidt, Christoph; Bruns, Christian; Palmer, Mike; Nietlispach, Bruno; Leifert, Carlo and Tamm, Lucius (2007) Soil biological quality in short- and long-term field trials with conventional and organic fertility input types. Paper at: 3rd QLIF Congress: Improving Sustainability in Organic and Low Input Food Production Systems, University of Hohenheim, Germany, March 20-23, 2007.
